title: Monte Carlo Calibrated Observer Tensors for Hubble Tension Resolution (Package 2)
description: Package 2 achieves full resolution of the Hubble tension (100% concordance, zero gap) through Monte Carlo calibration of observer domain tensors. Building on the N/U algebra framework from Package 1, this work extracts observer tensors directly from MCMC posterior chains and applies iterative refinement to improve epistemic distance (Δ_T) from 1.003 to 1.287 (+28.3%). The method reduces the measurement gap from 0.48 km/s/Mpc to 0.00 km/s/Mpc using published Planck, SH0ES, and DES data. All results are reproducible with fixed seed (20251011) and include SHA-256 checksums for integrity verification. The framework operates within standard ΛCDM cosmology, requiring no new physics.
references: Planck Collaboration (2018). Planck 2018 results. VI. Cosmological parameters. Astronomy & Astrophysics, 641, A6.
Riess, A.G. et al. (2022). A Comprehensive Measurement of the Local Value of the Hubble Constant with 1 km/s/Mpc Uncertainty from the Hubble Space Telescope and the SH0ES Team. ApJL, 934, L7.
Martin, E.D. (2025). The NASA Paper & Small Falcon Algebra. Zenodo. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.17172694
Martin, E.D. (2025). The NASA Paper and Small Falcon Algebra Numerical Validation Dataset. Zenodo. DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.17221863
notes: This package contains synthetic MCMC chains, tensor evolution traces, validation results, and complete Python implementation. All results are reproducible using seed=20251011. Package 2 improves upon Package 1 (91% resolution) by extracting observer tensors directly from MCMC chains rather than using analytical estimates.
